answers.answer: It helps with keeping your stamina up when labor comes.
It keeps your weight down as well :)
So your baby won't stick to you like literally and also so your legs wont get huge
Healthy Mom, healthy pregnancy, healthy baby!

Exercise when pregnant is important and stressed by doctors to be healthy. The most important thing about being pregnant. It helps your heart and mind and body, as well as the babies, and assists you in curbing things like gestational diabetes along with a healthy diet.Unless you've been told not to exercise by your doctor, it's really important to at least do low impact work outs just like taking a nightly stroll in the neighborhood.
I have been told by my MFM to walk to help keep G.D. away and also to help keep my BP down. So far i haven't had GD and my BP has gone down.
Sush good points on the importance of walking/exercising.Bump

question: Why do they say exercise while pregnant? I hear that it's not true that it makes labor easier so why do they stress walking? But I did hear that once you actually dilated it helps to start walking . But from my understanding everyone is different.
title: walkimg while pregnant
